info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 06 at 4:33PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT TUESDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Tuesday. An Air Quality Alert for Smoke has been issued. * WHAT... Localized areas of unhealthy air quality will continue for areas mainly to the east and southeast of the Black fire in the Gila National Forest, which has grown nearly 25 thousand acres in the past three days. The most impactful smoke continues to originate along the fires southern perimeter. Near surface smoke here will be transported toward the east-northeast this afternoon and into the evening while higher level smoke drifts more toward east through early Tuesday. * WHERE... Near-surface impacts will be most significant and widespread in southeast Catron, northeast Grant, and much western Sierra counties. This includes Kingston, Hillsboro, and the I-25 corridor from near Elephant Butte and Truth or Consequences to Caballo. More details and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN... Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1pm MDT Tuesday, June 7th.
